snippet: During a heated session of Parliament, government and opposition officials rejected the $10 million bounty for a militant leader linked to the 2008 attacks in Mumbai, India.
abstract: Pakistani government and opposition unite in criticism of newly announced $10 million American bounty for Hafiz Saeed, militant leader accused of orchestrating the 2008 attacks in Mumbai, India; lawmakers demand during heated session of Parliament that Washington provide proof of Saeed’s terrorist credentials.

byline.contributor: Waqar Gillani contributed reporting from Lahore, Pakistan.

lead_paragraph: During a heated session of Parliament, government and opposition officials rejected the $10 million bounty for a militant leader linked to the 2008 attacks in Mumbai, India.

headline.seo: Pakistanis Criticize U.S. Reward for Militant
headline.main: Pakistani Lawmakers Criticize U.S. Reward for Militant Leader
headline.print_headline: Pakistani Lawmakers Object To U.S. Reward for Militant
